contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Film | name = It's All About Love | image = It's All About Love_poster.JPG| director = [[Thomas Vinterberg]] | writer = Thomas Vinterberg <BR> [[Mogens Rukov]] | starring = [[Joaquin Phoenix]] <BR> [[Sean Penn]] <BR> [[Claire Danes]]| music = [[Zbigniew Preisner]]| editing = [[Valdís Óskarsdóttir]] | studio = [[Nimbus Film]] | released = {{Film date|df=y|2003|1|10}} | runtime = 105 minutes | country = Denmark | language = English | budget = $10,000,000<ref name="VV">[http://www.villagevoice.com/film/0443,lim2,57860,20.html village voice > film > It's All About Love by Dennis Lim<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> | |}} '''''It's All About Love''''' is a 2003 [[Romance film|romance]]-[[Drama film|drama]] film written and directed by [[Thomas Vinterberg]]. Its narrative can be classified as [[Apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic science fiction|apocalyptic science fiction]], but Vinterberg prefers to call it "a dream".{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}} Unlike the director's earlier Danish-language films, ''It's All About Love'' is entirely in English and stars [[Joaquin Phoenix]], [[Claire Danes]] and [[Sean Penn]]. The production was led by Denmark's [[Nimbus Film]], but the film was largely an international co-production, with involvement of companies from nine different countries in total. It was very poorly received by film critics. ==Cast== * [[Joaquin Phoenix]] as John * [[Claire Danes]] as Elena * [[Sean Penn]] as Marciello * [[Douglas Henshall]] as Michael * [[Alun Armstrong (actor)|Alun Armstrong]] as David * [[Margo Martindale]] as Betsy * [[Mark Strong]] as Arthur * [[Geoffrey Hutchings]] as Mr. Morrison ==Production== {{Unreferenced section|date=April 2011}} The film was written, directed, and produced by [[Thomas Vinterberg]] over a period of five years. It was produced through [[Nimbus Film]]. At a certain point during production Vinterberg called up [[Ingmar Bergman]] and asked him to come and help him finish the film, as he felt he could not complete it himself. Vinterberg recalled that: :He roared with laughter and said I had to be out of my mind. There was nothing he was less interested in. And he also said I was an idiot that had not decided fast enough what to do after ''[[The Celebration]] (Festen)'', which he, by the way, called a masterpiece. It was a very contended conversation. (From an interview in [[Berlingske Tidende]].) ==Reception== The film was not very successful, and critics mostly panned it.<ref name="RT">Rotten Tomatoes [http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/its_all_about_love/ rating]: 14% positive. For individual reviews, see box on the right.</ref> [[Richard Roeper]] called the film "like [[Stanley Kubrick|Kubrick]] with a talent-ectomy" and Jack Matthews of the ''[[New York Daily News]]'' declared that "Surely, Vinterberg was high on some inert gas when he embarked on it".<ref name="RT" /> Dennis Lim of the ''[[Village Voice]]'', however found something to like in the film: :''It's All About Love'' is, by any measure, a colossal folly – ridiculed at its [[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance]] '03 premier, supposedly disowned by its stars (rumor has it Claire Danes burst into tears upon seeing the end result) and jettisoned by original distributor [[Focus Features|Focus]]. But this $10 million Danish-British-French-U.S.-Japanese-Swedish-Norwegian-German-Dutch co-production is a film maudit for the ages — rapturous and inexplicable in equal measure.<ref name="VV" /> == References == {{reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.nimbusfilm.dk/itsallaboutlove/ Official website] * {{IMDb title|0273689|It's All About Love}} *[http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/collective/a2286623 Director interview about film] *[http://www.nimbusfilm.dk/enter_content.html Nimbus Film official website] {{Thomas Vinterberg}} [[Category:2003 films]] [[Category:2000s science fiction films]] [[Category:Danish science fiction films]] [[Category:Danish drama films]] [[Category:2000s romantic drama films]] [[Category:Films set in the 2020s]] [[Category:Films shot in Denmark]] [[Category:Films directed by Thomas Vinterberg]] [[Category:English-language films]] {{2000s-romantic-drama-film-stub}} {{Denmark-film-stub}}
